title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York City after being expelled from Pencey Prep.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: The story of young girl Scout Finch and her father, Atticus Finch, who is an attorney defending a black man accused of raping a white woman.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in Airstrip One, formerly Great Britain, a province of the superstate Oceania.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The story primarily concerns the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion and obsession for the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The story follows the main character Elizabeth Bennet as she deals with issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of the British Regency.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The story is set in a time "between the Dawn of Færie and the Dominion of Men", and follows the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by the dragon, Smaug.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The sequel to The Hobbit, and is the second and third installment in Tolkien's epic fantasy series.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The story follows Harry Potter, a young wizard who discovers his magical heritage on his eleventh birthday when he receives a letter of acceptance to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
author: Lewis Carroll
description: The story follows a young girl named Alice who falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar creatures.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: The story is set in the antebellum Southern United States, and is a direct sequel to The Adventures of Tom Sawyer.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The story follows the adventures of the narrator Ishmael as he sails on the whaling ship Pequod, under the command of Captain Ahab.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel set in the Napoleonic era, it concerns the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era on Tsarist society.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: The story focuses on the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of Rodion Raskolnikov, an impoverished ex-student in St. Petersburg who formulates a plan to kill an unscrupulous pawnbroker for her money.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: The story focuses on the journey home of Odysseus, king of Ithaca, after the fall of Troy.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The story follows the Buendía family's history in

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: The story revolves around a young man named Dorian Gray, who becomes the subject of a painting by artist Basil Hallward.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The story follows the adventures of an elderly man named Alonso Quixano who believes himself to be a knight, who sets out with his loyal squire Sancho Panza on a quest to revive chivalry and bring justice to the world.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: The story follows Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: The story revolves around the murder of Fyodor Pavlovich Karamazov, an immoral and lecherous landowner, at the hands of his son Dmitri Fyodorovich Karamazov, a desperate and passionate man.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: The story takes place in France, Italy, and islands in the Mediterranean during the historical events of 1815–1839.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The story follows Jonathan Harker, a young English lawyer, as he travels to Transylvania to meet Count Dracula, who then travels to England to spread the undead curse.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: The story is set during the Trojan War, the ten-year siege of the city of Troy by a coalition of Greek states.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: The story describes Dante's journey through Hell, guided by the ancient Roman poet Virgil.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: The story's protagonist Meursault is an indifferent Algerian, who indifferent to society and its rules.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: The story follows the lives and interactions of several characters, focusing on the struggles of ex-convict Jean Valjean and his experience of redemption.
